observation: I can see a country selection page with a dropdown that shows 'Select' placeholder and a 'Next' button. There are language selection modals open on both sides of the screen. I also see many countries listed with their flags. I need to dismiss the language modals first, then select a country from the dropdown.
reasoning: As an elderly user, I need to first close these distracting language modal overlays that are covering parts of the screen. I can see close buttons on both sides. I should close one of them first to clear the screen and then proceed with country selection.
ux_issues: Multiple modal overlays are open simultaneously, creating visual clutter and confusion
Small close button may be difficult for elderly users to target accurately

outcome.visual_observation: The language modal overlay with globe icon and 'EN' text has been closed/dismissed. The main sign-up flow page is now fully visible without any modal overlay, showing the 'Select your residence' form with country/region dropdown and Next button.
